meanings.definition: A unit of capacity equal to one cubic decimeter (1.0567 quarts).
meanings.sent1: The bottle contained two litres of water.
meanings.sent2: She poured three litres of milk into the jug.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled a few litres of juice on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was like pouring litres of fuel on a fire.
meanings.sent5: The lake shimmered under the sun, reflecting its vastness in litres of water.

meanings.definition: A metric unit of capacity, formerly defined as the volume of one kilogram of pure water under standard conditions, now equal to 1,000 cubic centimeters (about 1.75 pints).
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for two litres of milk.
meanings.sent2: The tank can hold up to five litres of gasoline.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she needed litres of coffee to stay awake.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was immeasurable, like litres of overflowing emotions.
meanings.sent5: The storm poured down litres of rain, flooding the streets.
